result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey Lloyd Ladwig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with S. Wollitz and/or B. Wollitz.
No DNA sample ordered as Defendant previously provided the same through another conviction.   Mandatory DNA Surcharge ordered by the Court.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey Lloyd Ladwig

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:15 PM: Defendant Casey Lloyd Ladwig in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint Recommendation recited by ADA.  Atty Rashid and Def concur with State's recital.  Atty Rashid argues as to State's request for no contact provisions.    Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts resolution.  75 days WCJ - I/S (Huber, GT, No TS credit if revoked) - S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; No contact with S.W. and/or B.W.   DNA Sample already on file per bailiff and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 31, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD. Attorney David C. Rashid in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Attorney Rashid regarding status. Statement by Attorney Rashid regarding status of matter due to matters in Green Lake still pending.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 31, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on December 27, 2016 at 09:40 am.

Status conference on October 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Atty Blader appears telephonically. Atty Rashid appears telephonically. Atty Rashid requesting another STC as he was recently appointed. DA Blader - possible consolidation with Green Lake Co, no objection to another STC. Status conference October 11, 2016 @ 9:00.

Case called @ 2:12 p.m. Defendant Casey Lloyd Ladwig in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader. Statement by DE. Defendant is not prepared to accept the offer extended by the State. Defendant referred to SPD to verify eligibility for an attorney.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Case Called @ 1:49 PM: Defendant Casey Lloyd Ladwig in court, appearing Pro Se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def prepared to ask the Court for an adjournment today.  Per ADA - Def is trying to obtain out of state information regarding illegal prescription alleged.  Per Def:  Has obtained some of the required information, but still needs additional time - approx 30 days.  Court advises Def of federal law requirement on executing a release for the required information.   P/S adjourned as requested.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 3:16 PM: Defendant Casey Lloyd Ladwig not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant authorized with forfeiture of cash bond posted.  As to 16TR-621 - default authorized - 6 mos DL Rev, $811.50 forfeiture, OWI assessment prior to any re-licensing.  $42.50 add'l cost of the blood draw fee ordered.
